text: Noble Ray Price (January 12, 1926 - December 16, 2013) was an American country music singer, songwriter and guitarist. Some of his famous songs were "Release Me", "Crazy Arms", "Heartaches by the Number", "For the Good Times", "Night Life", and "You're the Best Thing That Ever Happened to Me". He was elected to the Country Music Hall of Fame in 1996 and—even into his late 80s—continued to record and tour. Price died at his home in Mt. Pleasant, Texas on December 16, 2013 from pancreatic cancer. == Related pages == *List of country musicians from Texas ==References== ==Other websites== * * The "Ray Price Shuffle" with audio examples * at the Country Music Hall of Fame * Allmusic Ray Price with Biography, Discography, Charts Category:1926 births Category:2013 deaths Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer Category:Singer-songwriters from Texas Category:American guitarists Category:Country musicians from Texas
title: Ray Price
